Key Match Events: Jaden Ivey was severely injured after an unintentional blow from Cole Anthony, which may end his season.
Cole Anthony was overcome with emotion and cried inconsolably after the incident.
Jaden Ivey played 27 minutes and scored 22 points before exiting the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Detroit head coach J.B. Bickerstaff was visibly emotional and shared his thoughts on the atmosphere in the locker room.
Bickerstaff highlighted the strong bond and genuine care the players have for one another during difficult moments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Detroit Pistons won the game 105-96 against the Orlando Magic.
The incident left fans inside Little Caesars Arena in stunned silence.
Others: Cole Anthony was not the only one deeply affected by the incident, as Detroit guard Ausar Thompson and head coach J.B. Bickerstaff were also visibly shaken.
Jaden Ivey shot 8 of 11 from the field, including 5 of 6 from 3-point range, along with one rebound, four assists and one steal.
